BuildingTypes.Name: Simple Hut
BuildingTypes.Text: People who work sadly also need a place to sleep

BuildingTypes.Name: Cabin
BuildingTypes.Text: A comfortable living space. At least better than before.

BuildingTypes.Name: House
BuildingTypes.Text: One house connected to another house still equals just one house.

BuildingTypes.Name: Ghetto
BuildingTypes.Text: Cramped and ugly but full of hopeful people.

BuildingTypes.Name: Guardhouse
BuildingTypes.Text: Their most important job is just being there

Upgrades.Effect: Reduce Guardhouse Cost by 200% (actually reduces Stone cost to 1/4, Weaponry cost to 1/10)

BuildingTypes.Name: Apartment Complex
BuildingTypes.Text: Now you can have neighbors above your neighbors.

BuildingTypes.Name: Delving Outpost
BuildingTypes.Text: A singular outpost on top of the hole. Makes everything easier.

Upgrades.Effect: Delving Outpost land usage goes from 2 to 4 land

BuildingTypes.Name: Dungeon Entrance
BuildingTypes.Text: Now multiple well lit ways lead into the deep.

BuildingTypes.Name: Thieves Den
BuildingTypes.Text: They are good for the economy.

BuildingTypes.Name: Shop
BuildingTypes.Text: Sells and buys anything you want and need.

Upgrades.Effect: Halves cost of Shop and Tavern

BuildingTypes.Name: Tavern
BuildingTypes.Text: Its greatest export are drunken tales... and beer.

Upgrades.Effect: Halves cost of Shop and Tavern

BuildingTypes.Name: Temple / Cathedral
BuildingTypes.Text:
They call them Reliquaries
But it's all nonsense. / Grand decadent halls full of gold, silver and glass.

Upgrades.Effect: (upgrade to +5% food gain, +10 max treasure storage, +10 max artifact storage, adds Luxuries [5x Treasure] and Land [-10 total] to cost)

BuildingTypes.Name: Wooden Granary
BuildingTypes.Text: A local hotspot for hunters and gatherers and the like.

Upgrades.Effect: Reduce Workshop and Granary Cost by 0.5

BuildingTypes.Name: Food Market
BuildingTypes.Text: Fresh produce every day of the week. Except holidays. Sorry.

BuildingTypes.Name: Farmstead
BuildingTypes.Text: The home of carrots, cabbages and dairy products.

BuildingTypes.Name: Mill
BuildingTypes.Text: Does the wind ever tire of blowing?

Upgrades.Effect: Double storage, add Fabric to cost (same amount as wood), increase land use x 2 (-4)
Reduce workshop costs by *0.5 (ACTUALLY DOES WAREHOUSE! divided by 2)
Reduce warehouse cost by [count] *0.2 [CONVERT TO ALTERABLE VALUE ???]
Reduce Workshop and Granary Cost by 0.5
Upgrade to Factory (+3 max industrial jobs, +3% industrial action gain, land cost * 10)
